entry.title: Crypto Futures ETFs Raise More Than $73 Million Ahead of Hong Kong Launch
entry.summary:
Hong Kongâ€™s first crypto-based exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have attracted over $73 million ahead of their debut on the regionâ€™s stock exchange. The launch of the two ETFs tracking cryptocurrency futures listed in the United States comes despite the industryâ€™s current troubles.
Hong Kong Debuts Bitcoin and Ether Futures ETFs Amid Crypto Winter
Two ETFs tracking crypto futures raised a total of $73.6 million ahead of their debut on the stock exchange in Hong Kong on Friday, with the larger one raising $53.9 million, according to Reuters. The news agency noted that the launch is in defiance of the ongoing turmoil in the sector.
The funds, offered by CSOP Asset Management, invest in bitcoin (BTC) and ether (ETH) futures listed on the CME exchange in the U.S., the only crypto assets alloâ€¦

In the aftermath of the FTX collapse, regulators across the world are looking to tighten crypto regulations. This time, a french senate member has expressed the need for crypto licensing. Senator HervÃ© MaureyÂ recently proposed an amendment that crypto businesses should not be allowed to operate without full operational licenses. This is due to the current global market trend and tightening in recent times.
Elimination Clause From HervÃ© Maurey
A French Senate financial commission member, HervÃ© Maurey, proposed an amendment to a bill that allowed digital asset providers to operate without a license until 2026. The elimination clause from Maurey proposes that all crypto platforms should be required to get full operational licenses which would allow for tighter regulations of their activitâ€¦

entry.title: Elon Musk Suspends Several Journalists, Crypto Twitter Reports Issues
entry.summary:
Twitter boss Elon Musk has suspended the accounts of several journalists. While the mainstream media harshly criticizes Musk, numerous voices are supporting the decision. Meanwhile, Crypto Twitter is reporting other issues that are probably not related to it.
The exclusion of journalists from the New York Times, Washington Post, and CNN, among others, followed Muskâ€™s decision Wednesday to permanently suspend an account that had tracked his private jetâ€™s flights. Tweets from the account @elonjet, an account that tracks the air movement of the billionaire, which had more than 526,000 followers, were no longer visible Wednesday.
Owner Jack Sweeney told the AP news agency that when he logged in, he was shown a message stating that his account was permanently suspended for rule violations. â€¦

entry.title: ECB Hikes Interest Rates by 50bps; Signals Need for Further Hikes to Fight Inflation
entry.summary: The European Central Bank (ECB) decided to hike three of its key interest rates by 50 basis points (0.5%) as part of its ongoing war against inflation. The organization stated that further increases are likely to happen â€œbecause inflation remains far too high and is projected to stay above the target for too long.â€ ECB Follows Federal Reserve, Hiking Interest Rates by 50 Basis Points The European Central Bank (ECB) has explained its economic policy in its war against inflation. The governing council of the body decided to hike the interest rates on its main refinancing operations, its marginal lending facility, and its deposit facility by 50 basis points (bps) across the board. In a press release, the organization explained that this rise is part of a plan to ensure a â€œtimely returnâ€ to thâ€¦

entry.title: Trump Is Now Selling His Own Superhero NFTs â€“ After Thrashing Bitcoin For Being A â€˜Scamâ€™
entry.summary:
Look what people put up with to stay relevant. One way to do it, in todayâ€™s society, is to get into the tech bandwagon, like the so-called NFTs.
If it ever crossed your mind to spend some time off at a posh resort and national historic landmark in Palm Beach, Florida and have a tete-a-tete with a former American president, then this is your chance.
But first, you will need to buy an NFT at $99. What kind of NFT, you might ask? A Donald Trump NFT!
Now, hold on a minute. Isnâ€™t this the same fella who said Bitcoin is a scam? Yup, he is.
Former United States President Donald Trump, who once had a low opinion on cryptocurrencies and described them as potentially â€œa disaster waiting to happenâ€ made what he called an â€œimportant announcementâ€ on Thursday.
â€œHello, everyone this is Doâ€¦

entry.title: Web3 Applications Will Increasingly Be Built on Custom Blockchains, Says Ankrâ€™s Head of Product
entry.summary:
As blockchain developers compete for traffic and resources for their respective dapps (decentralized applications), the downside to this, according to some in the industry, can be a poor user experience which in turn undermines the mass adoption cause. Therefore, unless current blockchains â€” both Layers 1 and 2 â€” can overcome niggling issues like high gas fees or poor network speed, it will be difficult to convince traditional organizations that they need the tech, according to Ankrâ€™s Josh Neuroth.
Overcoming Blockchain Scalability Challenges
In cases where an attempt to improve a blockchainâ€™s transaction throughput is made, history has shown that compromises that might affect the chainâ€™s security may have to be made. Alternatively, developers can consider overcoming this problem, kâ€¦

entry.title: Bank of Russia Moves to Safeguard Crypto Companies Against Sanctions
entry.summary:
The Central Bank of Russia has introduced measures to protect entities working with digital assets from sanctions pressures. These businesses will be exempted from some reporting requirements as part of a regulatory relief intended to minimize the burden on financial organizations.
Russiaâ€™s Central Bank Eases Supervision of Digital Asset Platforms Amid Sanctions
The Central Bank of the Russian Federation (CBR) has allowed issuers of digital financial assets (DFAs) not to disclose information sensitive in the light of sanctions risks. The exemption, valid until July 1, 2023, concerns data revealing the beneficial owners of such entities.
According to an announcement quoted by Russian crypto media, the temporary reporting relief is part of a package of measures meant to help persons anâ€¦

entry.title: Why Bitcoin Is The Ultimate Wealth Preservation Technology
entry.summary: Bitcoin provides the ultimate form of transferable value because it preserves the encapsulated wealth. This is an opinion editorial by Leon Wankum, one of the first financial economics students to write a thesis about Bitcoin in 2015. Evolutionary psychologists believe that the ability to "preserve wealth" gave modern humans the decisive edge in evolutionary competition with other humans. Nick Szabo wrote an interesting anecdote about how in his essay â€œShelling Out: The Origins of Money.â€ When homosapiens displaced homo neanderthalensis in Europe circa 40,000 to 35,000 B.C., population explosions followed. It's difficult to explain why, because the newcomers, homosapiens, had the same size brain, weaker bones and smaller muscles than the neanderthals. The biggest difference may have been wâ€¦

U.S. Senators Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) and Roger Marshall (R-KS) introduced new legislation to regulate the cryptocurrency sector Wednesday. Their bill, titled â€œDigital Asset Anti-Money Laundering Act of 2022,â€ seeks to crack down on money laundering in the crypto industry.
Senator Warren tweeted Wednesday:
By closing some loopholes and applying some common-sense rules, we can crack down on the ways rogâ€¦

The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's businessâ€”plus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what heâ€™s looking forward to in Web3.

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Tornado Cash Sanctions, Ethereum Merge, DAOs and NFTs at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: In an extensive talk with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Decrypt in Napa CA in October, Edward Snowden gave his candid views on the Ethereum merge, the sanctioning of Ethereum mixer Tornado Cash by the U.S. government, the privacy shortcomings of Bitcoin and Ethereum, and his view on using DAOs to source tips from whistleblowers.

entry.title: The New Landscape for NFT Drops: Bad Grrls Creative Club, BeetsDAO, and Cymbal at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: Amid a crypto bear market and recent declines in NFT sales volume, what's the new roadmap for new NFT collections? What's expected by community members and collectors? Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club, Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO, and Eric Feng of NFT block explorer discussed with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Camp Decrypt Napa.

entry.title: Musician 3LAU on His Music NFT Platform Royal: 'We Take Compliance Really Seriously'
entry.summary: Justin Blau aka 3LAU, CEO of Royal, talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin about building his company around compliance from the start. "We take compliance so seriously that it might make us move a little bit slower... but we think that's really how we have to build in the space." He also said he looks to Coinbase as a model.
